Name: Elephant Hotel
Description: The Somers Elephant Hotel is the main administrative building and Town Hall for the town of Somers, New York. The name originates after the town mascot - Old Bet - stemming from the town's title as the "cradle of the American circus" after Hacaliah Bailey imported and kept an African Elephant in the town, attracting a number of visitors from across the US

Name: King Kone
Description: King Kone is a famous ice cream shop in the town of Somers, acting as a hub for delicious food situated alongside NY Route 100

Name: Muscoot Farm
Description: Muscoot Farm is a public county park located in Somers, offering a variety of farm-related programming. The farm maintains a number of animals such as cows, chickens, horses, and goats, and also hosts a popular farmers market on Sundays during the warmer months of the year.

Name: Somers Hot Bagels
Description: Somers Hot Bagels is a delicious bakery in Somers, located in the Somers Crossings shopping center only 5 minutes away from the Somers High School. Unfortunately, Somers Hot Bagels is closed as of January 2019.

Name: Somers High School
Description: Somers High School is the only public high school in Somers, offering educational services for around 1,100 students grades 9-12. Somers High School is known for a great sports program in the NY State Class A, winning two wrestling state championships in 2009 and 2011, the football state championship in 2016, and the women's soccer state championship in 2016.

Name: Amawalk Reservoir
Description: The Amawalk Reservoir is a body of water situated in the center of Somers. This reservoir is apart of a larger network of reservoirs that provides water to the population of New York City. It is also a popular fishing spot for Somers town residents.
